intro: Erica lanipes, commonly known as the woolly heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its small, needle-like leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. Erica lanipes produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique biome in South Africa.
